intro: Campylospermum walkeri, commonly known as the white-flowered sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained sandy soils and full sun, making it adaptable to arid environments. Its flowers are typically borne on erect stems and bloom during the cooler months. Campylospermum walkeri is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
